required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Structural Cartography of the Insula in Temporal Epilepsy Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Structural Cartography of the Insula in Temporal Epilepsy Patients

collaborator.agency: Centre de Recherche du Centre Hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate insula structural connectivity in temporal epilepsy patients. Insula being at the interface of frontal, parietal, occipital and temporal lobes, its structural organization reflects the brain function. We hypothetize that insular structural organization will be different according to the different subtypes of temporal epilepsy.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate insula structural connectivity in temporal epilepsy patients. Insula being at the interface of frontal, parietal, occipital and temporal lobes, its structural organization reflects the brain function. We hypothetize that insular structural organization will be different according to the different subtypes of temporal epilepsy.

primary_outcome.measure: cartography of insula in temporal epilepsy patients
primary_outcome.description: Compared with healthy group, definition of different patterns of insular structural connectivity in epileptic patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation structural cartography and electroclinical data
secondary_outcome.description: correlation between patterns of insular structural connectivity and subtypes of epilepsy defined by electroclinical data

arm_group.description: patients suffering from mesiotemporal epilepsy type
patients suffering from basal temporal epilepsy type
patients suffering from temporal lateral epilepsy type
patients suffering from operculo insular epilepsy type
patients suffering from temporo- insular epilepsy type

study_pop.textblock:
temporal epilepsy patients and healthy subjects
healthy subjects will be selected in the healthy cohort of Nguyen G-Dang (Ghaziri et al., 2017)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- epileptic patients: temporal epilepsy or temporal plus epilepsy (temporomesial epilepsy, basal temporal epilepsy, mesio lateral or lateral epilepsy, temporo insular epilepsy, operculo insular epilepsy)
- patients who underwent video EEG monitoring with recorded seizures (at least one)
- patients who underwent a brain MRI with DTI sequence before epilepsy surgery
- patients who did not refuse the use of their clinical and MRI data for this study
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients younger than 15 years old
- patients with previous brain surgery (before MRI)
- uncompleted MRI sequences (DTI, T1 anatomical)

overall_official.affiliation: CHRU Nancy, CRAN UMR 7039 Université de Lorraine
